page.title: 14Sport in Ferryhill
page.content: Organised sport in the area has a traditional North-Eastern flavour-the largest participatory sport being football.Ferryhill Athletic are members of the Dryborough Northern League.They have their own floodlit ground and social club.The ground has held over 5000 spectators but current attendances rarely exceed 200.There are a further 14 football teams playing in minor leagues(Saturday or Sunday).They share 6 pitches on 3 council owned sites. Mainsforth Cricket Club fields teams in two divisions of the Durham County League.Their ground,once the miner's welfare ground,is now owned by Sedge- field District Council.
